trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Integrating Google Apps with Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Integrating Google Apps with Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Google Apps with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Google Apps with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: How to integrate Google Apps with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: How to integrate Google Apps with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will show you how to connect your Google Apps environment to your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will show you how to connect your Google Apps environment to your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to configure single sign-on to Google Apps, how to enable automated user provisioning, and how to assign users to have access to Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to configure single sign-on to Google Apps, how to enable automated user provisioning, and how to assign users to have access to Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To access Azure Active Directory through the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you must first have a valid Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: To access Azure Active Directory through the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you must first have a valid Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must have a valid tenant for [Google Apps for Work](https://www.google.com/work/apps/) or [Google Apps for Education](https://www.google.com/edu/products/productivity-tools/).
trans-unit.target: You must have a valid tenant for [Google Apps for Work](https://www.google.com/work/apps/) or [Google Apps for Education](https://www.google.com/edu/products/productivity-tools/).

trans-unit.source: You may use a free trial account for either service.
trans-unit.target: You may use a free trial account for either service.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Add Google Apps to your Directory
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Add Google Apps to your Directory

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Select Active Directory from the left navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Select Active Directory from the left navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory that you would like to add Google Apps to.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory that you would like to add Google Apps to.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Click on Applications.
trans-unit.target: Click on Applications.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click Add to add a new application.
trans-unit.target: Click Add to add a new application.

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **Google Apps**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **Google Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Then select **Google Apps** from the results, and click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: Then select **Google Apps** from the results, and click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Add Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: Add Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the Quick Start page for Google Apps:
trans-unit.target: You should now see the Quick Start page for Google Apps:

trans-unit.source: Google Apps' Quick Start page in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Google Apps' Quick Start page in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Enable Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Enable Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, on the Quick Start page for Google Apps, click the **Configure single sign-on** button.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, on the Quick Start page for Google Apps, click the **Configure single sign-on** button.

trans-unit.source: The configure single sign-on button
trans-unit.target: The configure single sign-on button

trans-unit.source: A dialog will open and you'll see a screen that asks "How would you like users to sign on to Google Apps?"
trans-unit.target: A dialog will open and you'll see a screen that asks "How would you like users to sign on to Google Apps?"

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Select Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To learn more about about the different single sign-on options, [click here](../active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis/#how-does-single-sign-on-with-azure-active-directory-work)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To learn more about about the different single sign-on options, [click here](../active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis/#how-does-single-sign-on-with-azure-active-directory-work)

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App Settings** page, for the **Sign On URL** field, type in your Google Apps tenant URL using the following format: `https://mail.google.com/a/<yourdomain>`
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App Settings** page, for the **Sign On URL** field, type in your Google Apps tenant URL using the following format: `https://mail.google.com/a/<yourdomain>`

trans-unit.source: Type in your tenant URL
trans-unit.target: Type in your tenant URL

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Google Apps** page, click on **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Google Apps** page, click on **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Download the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Download the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Open a new tab in your browser, and sign into the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/) using your administrator account.
trans-unit.target: Open a new tab in your browser, and sign into the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/) using your administrator account.

trans-unit.source: Click **Security**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Security**.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the link, it may be hidden under the **More Controls** menu at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the link, it may be hidden under the **More Controls** menu at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Security.
trans-unit.target: Click Security.

trans-unit.source: On the **Security** page, click **Set up single sign-on (SSO).**
trans-unit.target: On the **Security** page, click **Set up single sign-on (SSO).**

trans-unit.source: Click SSO.
trans-unit.target: Click SSO.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following configuration changes:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following configuration changes:

trans-unit.source: Configure SSO
trans-unit.target: Configure SSO

trans-unit.source: Select **Setup SSO with third party identity provider**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Setup SSO with third party identity provider**.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, copy the **Single sign-on service URL**, and paste it into the **Sign-in page URL** field in Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, copy the **Single sign-on service URL**, and paste it into the **Sign-in page URL** field in Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, copy the **Single sign-out service URL**, and paste it into the **Sign-out page URL** field in Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, copy the **Single sign-out service URL**, and paste it into the **Sign-out page URL** field in Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, copy the **Change password URL**, and paste it into the **Change password URL** field in Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, copy the **Change password URL**, and paste it into the **Change password URL** field in Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: In Google Apps, for the **Verification certificate**, upload the certificate that you downloaded in step #4.
trans-unit.target: In Google Apps, for the **Verification certificate**, upload the certificate that you downloaded in step #4.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save Changes**.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation checkbox to enable the certificate that you uploaded to Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation checkbox to enable the certificate that you uploaded to Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Check the confirmation checkbox
trans-unit.target: Check the confirmation checkbox

trans-unit.source: On the final page of the dialog, type in an email address if you would like to receive email notifications for errors and warnings related to the maintenance of this single sign-on configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the final page of the dialog, type in an email address if you would like to receive email notifications for errors and warnings related to the maintenance of this single sign-on configuration.

trans-unit.source: Type in your email address.
trans-unit.target: Type in your email address.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, see the section below titled [Assign Users to Google Apps](#step-4-assign-users-to-google-apps).
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, see the section below titled [Assign Users to Google Apps](#step-4-assign-users-to-google-apps).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Enable Automated User Provisioning
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Enable Automated User Provisioning

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Another viable option for automating user provisioning to Google Apps is to use [Google Apps Directory Sync (GADS)](https://support.google.com/a/answer/106368?hl=en) which provisions your on-premises Active Directory identities to Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Another viable option for automating user provisioning to Google Apps is to use [Google Apps Directory Sync (GADS)](https://support.google.com/a/answer/106368?hl=en) which provisions your on-premises Active Directory identities to Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, the solution in this tutorial provisions your Azure Active Directory (cloud) users and mail-enabled groups to Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, the solution in this tutorial provisions your Azure Active Directory (cloud) users and mail-enabled groups to Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: Sign into the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/) using your administrator account, and click **Security**.
trans-unit.target: Sign into the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/) using your administrator account, and click **Security**.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the link, it may be hidden under the **More Controls** menu at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the link, it may be hidden under the **More Controls** menu at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Security.
trans-unit.target: Click Security.

trans-unit.source: On the **Security** page, click **API Reference**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Security** page, click **API Reference**.

trans-unit.source: Click API Reference.
trans-unit.target: Click API Reference.

trans-unit.source: Select **Enable API access**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Enable API access**.

trans-unit.source: Click API Reference.
trans-unit.target: Click API Reference.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For every user that you intend to provision to Google Apps, their username in Azure Active Directory *must* be tied to a custom domain.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For every user that you intend to provision to Google Apps, their username in Azure Active Directory *must* be tied to a custom domain.

trans-unit.source: For example, usernames that look like bob@contoso.onmicrosoft.com will not be accepted by Google Apps, whereas bob@contoso.com will be accepted.
trans-unit.target: For example, usernames that look like bob@contoso.onmicrosoft.com will not be accepted by Google Apps, whereas bob@contoso.com will be accepted.

trans-unit.source: You can change an existing user's domain by editing their properties in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: You can change an existing user's domain by editing their properties in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for how to set a custom domain for both Azure Active Directory and Google Apps are included below.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for how to set a custom domain for both Azure Active Directory and Google Apps are included below.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't added a custom domain name to your Azure Active Directory yet, then follow the steps below:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't added a custom domain name to your Azure Active Directory yet, then follow the steps below:

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: In the directory list, select your directory.
trans-unit.target: In the directory list, select your directory.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Domains** from the top-level menu, and then click on **Add a custom domain**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Domains** from the top-level menu, and then click on **Add a custom domain**.

trans-unit.source: Add a Custom Domain
trans-unit.target: Add a Custom Domain

trans-unit.source: Type your domain name into the **Domain name** field.
trans-unit.target: Type your domain name into the **Domain name** field.

trans-unit.source: This should be the same domain name that you intend to use for Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: This should be the same domain name that you intend to use for Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: When ready, click the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: When ready, click the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: Type in your domain name.
trans-unit.target: Type in your domain name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** to go to the verification page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** to go to the verification page.

trans-unit.source: To verify that you own this domain, you must edit the domain's DNS records according to the values provided on this page.
trans-unit.target: To verify that you own this domain, you must edit the domain's DNS records according to the values provided on this page.

trans-unit.source: You may choose to verify using either **MX records** or **TXT records**, depending on what you select for the **Record Type** option.
trans-unit.target: You may choose to verify using either **MX records** or **TXT records**, depending on what you select for the **Record Type** option.

trans-unit.source: For more comprehensive instructions on how to verify domain name with Azure AD, see [Add your own domain name to Azure AD](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=278919&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For more comprehensive instructions on how to verify domain name with Azure AD, see [Add your own domain name to Azure AD](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=278919&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: Verify your domain name.
trans-unit.target: Verify your domain name.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the above steps for all of the domains that you intend to add to your directory.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the above steps for all of the domains that you intend to add to your directory.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have verified all of your domains with Azure AD, you must now verify them again with Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have verified all of your domains with Azure AD, you must now verify them again with Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: For each domain that isn't already registered with Google Apps, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: For each domain that isn't already registered with Google Apps, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/), click on **Domains**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/), click on **Domains**.

trans-unit.source: Click on Domains
trans-unit.target: Click on Domains

trans-unit.source: Click **Add a domain or a domain alias**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add a domain or a domain alias**.

trans-unit.source: Add a new domain
trans-unit.target: Add a new domain

trans-unit.source: Select **Add another domain**, and type in the name of the domain that you would like to add.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add another domain**, and type in the name of the domain that you would like to add.

trans-unit.source: Type in your domain name
trans-unit.target: Type in your domain name

trans-unit.source: Click on **Continue and verify domain ownership**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Continue and verify domain ownership**.

trans-unit.source: Then follow the steps to verify that you own the domain name.
trans-unit.target: Then follow the steps to verify that you own the domain name.

trans-unit.source: For comprehensive instructions on how to verify your domain with Google Apps, see [Verify your site ownership with Google Apps](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35179).
trans-unit.target: For comprehensive instructions on how to verify your domain with Google Apps, see [Verify your site ownership with Google Apps](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35179).

trans-unit.source: Repeat the above steps for any additional domains that you intend to add to Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the above steps for any additional domains that you intend to add to Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If you change the primary domain for your Google Apps tenant, and if you have already configured single sign-on with Azure AD, then you will have to repeat step #3 under [Step Two: Enable Single Sign-On](#step-two-enable-single-sign-on).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If you change the primary domain for your Google Apps tenant, and if you have already configured single sign-on with Azure AD, then you will have to repeat step #3 under [Step Two: Enable Single Sign-On](#step-two-enable-single-sign-on).

trans-unit.source: In the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/), click on **Admin Roles**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Google Apps Admin Console](http://admin.google.com/), click on **Admin Roles**.

trans-unit.source: Click on Google Apps
trans-unit.target: Click on Google Apps

trans-unit.source: Determine which admin account you would like to use to manage user provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Determine which admin account you would like to use to manage user provisioning.

trans-unit.source: For the **admin role** of that account, edit the **Privileges** for that role.
trans-unit.target: For the **admin role** of that account, edit the **Privileges** for that role.

trans-unit.source: Make sure it has all of the **Admin API Privileges** enabled so that this account can be used for provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Make sure it has all of the **Admin API Privileges** enabled so that this account can be used for provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Click on Google Apps
trans-unit.target: Click on Google Apps

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are configuring a production environment, the best practice is to create a new admin account in Google Apps specifically for this step.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are configuring a production environment, the best practice is to create a new admin account in Google Apps specifically for this step.

trans-unit.source: These account must have an admin role associated with it that has the necessary API privileges.
trans-unit.target: These account must have an admin role associated with it that has the necessary API privileges.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Active Directory, click on **Applications** in the top-level menu, and then click on **Google Apps**.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Active Directory, click on **Applications** in the top-level menu, and then click on **Google Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Click on Google Apps
trans-unit.target: Click on Google Apps

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page for Google Apps, click on **Configure user provisioning**.
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page for Google Apps, click on **Configure user provisioning**.

trans-unit.source: Configure user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configure user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In the dialog that opens, click on **enable user provisioning** to authenticate into the Google Apps Admin Account that you would like to use to manage provisioning.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog that opens, click on **enable user provisioning** to authenticate into the Google Apps Admin Account that you would like to use to manage provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Enable provisioning
trans-unit.target: Enable provisioning

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you would like to give Azure Active Directory permission to make changes to your Google Apps tenant.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you would like to give Azure Active Directory permission to make changes to your Google Apps tenant.

trans-unit.source: Confirm permissions.
trans-unit.target: Confirm permissions.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Assign Users to Google Apps
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Assign Users to Google Apps

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, start creating a new test account in the directory.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, start creating a new test account in the directory.

trans-unit.source: On the Google Apps Quick Start page, click on the **Assign Users** button.
trans-unit.target: On the Google Apps Quick Start page, click on the **Assign Users** button.

trans-unit.source: Click on Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Click on Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, and click the **Assign** button at the bottom of the screen:
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, and click the **Assign** button at the bottom of the screen:

trans-unit.source: If you haven't enable automated user provisioning, then you'll see the following prompt to confirm:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't enable automated user provisioning, then you'll see the following prompt to confirm:

trans-unit.source: If you have enabled automated user provisioning, then you'll see a prompt to define what type of role the user should have in Google Apps.
trans-unit.target: If you have enabled automated user provisioning, then you'll see a prompt to define what type of role the user should have in Google Apps.

trans-unit.source: Newly provisioned users should appear in your Google Apps environment after a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Newly provisioned users should appear in your Google Apps environment after a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: To test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel at [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com/), then sign into the test account, and click on **Google Apps**.
trans-unit.target: To test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel at [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com/), then sign into the test account, and click on **Google Apps**.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
